XRRenderState.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRRenderState interface of the WebXR Device API contains configurable values which affect how the imagery generated by an gets composited. These properties include the range of distances from the viewer within which content should be rendered, the vertical field of view (for inline presentations), and a reference to the being used as the target for rendering the scene prior to it being presented on the XR device's display or displays.

remarks.para: When you apply changes using the XRSession method , the specified changes take effect after the current animation frame has completed, but before the next one begins.

XRRenderStateInlineVerticalFieldOfView.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only inlineVerticalFieldOfView
property of the interface returns the default vertical
field of view for "inline" sessions and null for all immersive
sessions.
XRRenderStateInlineVerticalFieldOfView.value:
A for "inline" sessions, which represents the default
field of view, and null for immersive sessions.

XRRenderStateDepthFar.summary:
NOTE Experimental The depthFar read-only property of the
interface returns the distance in meters of the far clip
plane from the viewer.

XRRenderStateDepthNear.summary:
NOTE Experimental The depthNear read-only property of the
interface returns the distance in meters of the near clip
plane from the viewer.

XRRenderStateBaseLayer.summary:
NOTE Experimental The read-only baseLayer property of the
interface returns the instance
that is the source of bitmap images and a description of how the image is to be rendered
in the device.

remarks.para:
This property is read-only; however, you can indirectly change its
value using .

XRRenderStateBaseLayer.value:
A object which is used as the source of the world's
contents when rendering each frame of the scene.See the examples below to see how to use to set the current XRWebGLLayer used for rendering
the scene.

XRRenderStateLayers.summary: NOTE Experimental The read-only layers property of the interface is an ordered array containing objects that are displayed by the XR compositor.
XRRenderStateLayers.value: An ordered array containing objects. The order of the layers is "back-to-front".
